009
010package imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.nonlinear;
011
012import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
014import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.Mapping2D;
016import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
017
018/**
019 * <p>
020 * This class represents a bilinear transformation in 2D with 8 parameters a0,
021 * ..., a3, b0, ..., b3 of the form
022 * </p>
023 * <pre>
024 * x' = a0 * x + a1 * y + a2 * x * y + a3
025 * y' = b0 * x + b1 * y + b2 * x * y + b3</pre>
026 * <p>
027 * Note that this is a non-linear transformation because of the mixed term x *
028 * y. See Secs. 21.1.5 and 21.3.1 of [1] for details.
029 * </p>
030 * <p>
031 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
032 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
033 * </p>
034 * 
035 * @author WB
036 */
037public class BilinearMapping2D implements Mapping2D {
038        
039        public final double a0, a1, a2, a3;
040        public final double b0, b1, b2, b3;
041        
042        public BilinearMapping2D(
043                        double a0, double a1, double a2, double a3,
044                        double b0, double b1, double b2, double b3) {
045                this.a0 = a0;   this.a1 = a1;   this.a2 = a2;   this.a3 = a3;
046                this.b0 = b0;   this.b1 = b1;   this.b2 = b2;   this.b3 = b3;           
047        }
048        
049        /**
050         * Calculates and returns the bilinear mapping M between two point
051         * sets P, Q, with 4 points each, such that q_i = M(p_i).
052         * The inverse mapping is obtained by simply swapping the two point sets.
053         * @param P the first point sequence
054         * @param Q the second point sequence
055         * @return a new bilinear mapping
056         */
057        public static BilinearMapping2D fromPoints(Pnt2d[] P, Pnt2d[] Q) {      
058                //define column vectors x, y
059                double[] x = {Q[0].getX(), Q[1].getX(), Q[2].getX(), Q[3].getX()};
060                double[] y = {Q[0].getY(), Q[1].getY(), Q[2].getY(), Q[3].getY()};              
061                // mount matrix M
062                double[][] M = new double[][]
063                        {{P[0].getX(), P[0].getY(), P[0].getX() * P[0].getY(), 1},
064                         {P[1].getX(), P[1].getY(), P[1].getX() * P[1].getY(), 1},
065                         {P[2].getX(), P[2].getY(), P[2].getX() * P[2].getY(), 1},
066                         {P[3].getX(), P[3].getY(), P[3].getX() * P[3].getY(), 1}};
067                double[] a = Matrix.solve(M, x);                // solve x = M * a = x (a is unknown)
068                double[] b = Matrix.solve(M, y);                // solve y = M * b = y (b is unknown)           
069                double a1 = a[0];               double b1 = b[0];
070                double a2 = a[1];               double b2 = b[1];
071                double a3 = a[2];               double b3 = b[2];
072                double a4 = a[3];               double b4 = b[3];
073                return new BilinearMapping2D(a1, a2, a3, a4, b1, b2, b3, b4);
074        }
075
076        @Override
077        public Pnt2d applyTo(Pnt2d pnt) {
078                final double x = pnt.getX();
079                final double y = pnt.getY();
080                double xx = a0 * x + a1 * y + a2 * x * y + a3;
081                double yy = b0 * x + b1 * y + b2 * x * y + b3;
082                return PntDouble.from(xx, yy);
083        }
084        
085        @Override
086        public String toString() {
087                return String.format(
088                                "BilinearMapping[A = (%.3f, %.3f, %.3f, %.3f) / B = (%.3f, %.3f, %.3f, %.3f)]",
089                                a0, a1, a2, a3, b0, b1, b2, b3);
090        }
091        
092        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
093        
094        /**
095         * For testing only.
096         * @param args ignored
097         */
098        public static void main(String[] args) {
099                Pnt2d[] P = {
100                                PntInt.from(2,5),
101                                PntInt.from(4,6),
102                                PntInt.from(7,9),
103                                PntInt.from(5,9),
104                                };
105                
106                Pnt2d[] Q = {
107                                PntInt.from(4,3),
108                                PntInt.from(5,2),
109                                PntInt.from(9,3),
110                                PntInt.from(7,5),
111                                };
112                
113                BilinearMapping2D bm = fromPoints(P, Q);
114                System.out.println("\nbilinear mapping = \n" + bm.toString());
115                
116                for (int i = 0; i < P.length; i++) {
117                        Pnt2d Qi = bm.applyTo(P[i]);
118                        System.out.println(P[i].toString() + " -> " + Qi.toString());
119                }       
120        }
121
122
123}
